maml:description.maml:para: Adds new deployment region to PsApiManagement instance.

Add-AzureRmApiManagementRegion cmdlet adds new instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRegion to collection of AdditionalRegions of provided instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagement. This cmdlet does not deploy anything by itself but updates instance of PsApiManagement in-memory. Related cmdltes are: Update-AzureRmApiManagementRegion and Remove-AzureRmApiManagementRegion. To actually update a deployment of an API Management pass the modified PsApiManagementInstance to Update-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet.
PsApiManagement instance to add additional deployment region to.
Location of the new deployment region.
Tier of the deployment region. Valid and Default value is Premium.
Sku capacity of the deployment region. Default value is 1.
Virtual network configuration. Default value is $null.
PsApiManagement instance to add additional deployment region to.
Location of the new deployment region.
Tier of the deployment region. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium. Default value is Developer.
Sku capacity of the deployment region. Default value is 1.
Virtual network configuration. Default value is $null.

maml:alert.maml:para: The cmdlet writes updated PsApiManagement instance to pipeline.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add new 2 units ‘Premium’ region to the PsApiManagement instance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmApiManagement –ResourceGroupName Contoso –Name ContosoApi | Add-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location “East US” -Sku “Premium” –Capacity 2 | Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployments

dev:remarks.maml:para: Script to get a PsApiManagement, add 2 ‘Premium’ units region and update deployment.

maml:description.maml:para: Backs up API Management Service and places the backup to the specified Azure storage blob.
Backup-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet makes a backup copy of an API Management Service and places the backup to the specified Azure storage blob.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
The storage connection context.
Name of target Azure Storage blob. If the blob does not exist it will be created.
Name of target Azure Storage blob. If the blob does not exist it will be created. The default value will be generated based on the following pattern: {Name}-{yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm}.apimbackup
Sends backed up PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
The storage connection context.
Name of target Azure Storage blob. If the blob does not exist it will be created.
Name of target Azure Storage blob. If the blob does not exist it will be created. The default value will be generated based on the following pattern: {Name}-{yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm}.apimbackup
Sends backed up PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Backup-AzureRmApiManagement –ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup –Name ContosoApi -StorageContext $storageContext -TargetContainerName ContosoBackups –TargetBlobName ContosoBackup.apimbackup

dev:remarks.maml:para: Backup API Management service to Azure storage blob.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list or a particular API Management Service description.
Get-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet gets a list of all API Management services under subscription or specified resource group or a particular API Management.
Name of resource group under which want to create API Management service.
Name of resource group under which want to create API Management service.
Name of API Management service.
Name of resource group under which want to create API Management service.
Name of API Management service.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all API Management services within subscription.
Get API Management service by name.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a link with an SSO token to a deployed management portal of an API Management service.
Get-AzureRmApiManagementSsoToken cmdlet returns a link (URL) containing an SSO token to a deployed management portal of an API Management service.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get SSO token of an API Management service.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports a certificate in a PFX format for an API Management Service.
Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate cmdlet imports a certificate in a PFX format for an API Management Service. The certificate is to be used for custom hostnames configuration.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Host name type to upload certificate for. Valid values are: Proxy, Portal
Path to a .pfx certificate file.
Password for the .pfx certificate file.
Sends imported PsApiManagementHostnameCertificate to pipeline if operation succeeds.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Host name type to upload certificate for. Valid values are: Proxy, Portal
Path to a .pfx certificate file.
Password for the .pfx certificate file.
Sends imported PsApiManagementHostnameCertificate to pipeline if operation succeeds.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Import a certificate for Proxy custom hostname.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates new API Management Service.
New-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet creates new API Management deployment.
Name of resource group under which you want to create API Management.
Name of API Management.
Location where want to create API Management.
The name of the organization for use in the developer portal in e-mail notifications.
The originating e-mail address for all e-mail notifications sent from the API Management system.
The tier of the Azure API Management service. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium . Default value is Developer
Sku capacity of the Azure API Management service. Default value is 1.

Virtual Network Type of the ApiManagement Deployment. Valid Values are - "None" (Default Value. ApiManagement is not part of any Virtual Network") - "External" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Internet Facing Endpoint) - "Internal" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Intranet Facing Endpoint)
Virtual Network Configuration of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Tags dictionary.
Additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Name of resource group under which you want to create API Management.
Name of API Management.
Location where want to create API Management.
The name of the organization for use in the developer portal in e-mail notifications.
The originating e-mail address for all e-mail notifications sent from the API Management system.
The tier of the Azure API Management service. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium . Default value is Developer
Sku capacity of the Azure API Management service. Default value is 1.
Tags dictionary.

Virtual Network Type of the ApiManagement Deployment. Valid Values are - "None" (Default Value. ApiManagement is not part of any Virtual Network") - "External" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Internet Facing Endpoint) - "Internal" (ApiManagement Deployment is setup inside a Virtual Network having an Intranet Facing Endpoint)
Virtual Network Configuration of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-AzureRmApiManagement –ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup –Name ContosoApi –Location "Central US" –Organization Contoso –AdminEmail admin@contoso.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create new ‘Developer’ tier API Management service

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-AzureRmApiManagement –ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup –Name ContosoApi –Location "Central US" –Organization Contoso –AdminEmail admin@contoso.com –Sku Standard –Capacity 3

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create new ‘Standard’ tier API Management service with 3 units

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$apimRegion = New-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "Central US"
$additionalRegions = @($apimRegion)
New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup -Location "West US" -Name ContosoApi -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -AdditionalRegions $additionalRegions -Sku "Premium"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a 'Premium' Tier ApiManagement service with Master Region in 'West US' and Additional Region in 'Central US'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$apimRegionVirtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork –Location "Central US" –SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/centralusvirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet"
$apimRegion = New-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "Central US" -VirtualNetwork $apimRegionVirtualNetwork
$additionalRegions = @($apimRegion)
$virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork –Location "West US" –SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-b1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/westUsVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet"
New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup -Location "West US" -Name ContosoApi -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -AdditionalRegions $additionalRegions -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "External" -Sku "Premium"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Developer Tier ApiManagement service in an Azure Virtual Network Subnet having an External Facing Gateway Endpoint with Master Region in West US and Additional Region in Central US.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an instance of PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration.
Helper command to create an instance of PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration. This command is to be used with Set-AzureRmApiManagementHostnames command.
Certificate thumbprint. The certificate must be first imported with Import-ApiManagementCertificate command.
Custom hostaname.
Certificate thumbprint. The certificate must be first imported with Import-ApiManagementCertificate command.
Custom hostaname.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create and initialize instance of Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagementHostnameConfiguration type.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an instance of PsApiManagementVirtualNetwork.
Helper command to create an instance of PsApiManagementVirtualNetwork. This command is to be used with Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment command.
Location of the virtual network.

The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the ApiManagement Service in. Example format:/subscriptions/{subid}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1.
Location of the virtual network.

The full resource ID of a subnet in a virtual network to deploy the ApiManagement Service in. Example format:/subscriptions/{subid}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/Microsoft.{Network|ClassicNetwork}/VirtualNetworks/vnet1/subnets/subnet1.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Script to create a virtual network and call run Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment command for ResourceManager VNET
Script to create a virtual network and call run Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment command for Classic VNET

maml:description.maml:para: Removes existing API Management.
Remove-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet removes existing API Management service.
Name of resource group under which API Management service exists.
Name of API Management service.
Writes true to the pipeline if operation succeeds.
Name of resource group under which API Management service exists.
Name of API Management service.
Writes true to the pipeline if operation succeeds.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove API Management service.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes existing deployment region from PsApiManagement instance.

Remove-AzureRmApiManagementRegion cmdlet removes instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRegion from collection of AdditionalRegions of provided instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagement. This cmdlet does not modifies deployment by itself but updates instance of PsApiManagement in-memory. Related cmdltes are: Update-AzureRmApiManagementRegion and Add-AzureRmApiManagementRegion. To actually update a deployment of an API Management pass the modified PsApiManagementInstance to Update-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet.
PsApiManagement instance to remove additional deployment region from.
Location of the removing region.
PsApiManagement instance to remove additional deployment region from.
Location of the removing region.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove a region from the PsApiManagement instance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmApiManagement –ResourceGroupName Contoso –Name ContosoApi | Remove-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location “East US” | Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment

dev:remarks.maml:para: Script to get a PsApiManagement, remove a region and update deployment with piping.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores an API Management Service from the specified Azure storage blob.
Restore-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet restores an API Management Service from the specified backup residing in an Azure storage blob.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
The storage connection context.
Name of Azure Storage backup source container.
Name of Azure Storage backup source blob.
Sends restored PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
The storage connection context.
Name of Azure Storage backup source container.
Name of Azure Storage backup source blob.
Sends restored PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Restore-AzureRmApiManagement –ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup –Name RestoredContosoApi -StorageContext $storageContext -SourceContainerName ContosoBackups –SourceBlobName ContosoBackup.apimbackup

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restore API Management service from Azure storage blob.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets custom hostname configuration for an API Management service proxy and/or portal.
Set-AzureRmApiManagementHostnames cmdlet sets (applies) custom hostname configuration for an API Management service proxy and/or portal.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Custom portal hostname configuration. Default value is $null. Passing $null will set the default hostname.
Custom proxy hostname configuration. Default value is $null. Passing $null will set the default hostname.
Sends updated PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
PsApiManagement instance to get PortalHostnameConfiguration and ProxyHostnameConfiguration from.
Sends updated PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Custom portal hostname configuration. Default value is $null. Passing $null will set the default hostname.
Custom proxy hostname configuration. Default value is $null. Passing $null will set the default hostname.
Sends updated PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
PsApiManagement instance to get PortalHostnameConfiguration and ProxyHostnameConfiguration from.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set custom hostname configuration for proxy and portal.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate -Name ContosoApi -ResourceGroupName Contoso –HostnameType “Proxy” -PfxPath “C:\proxycert.pfx” -PfxPassword “certsecret” Import-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameCertificate -Name ContosoApi -ResourceGroupName Contoso –HostnameType “Portal” -PfxPath “C:\portalcert.pfx” -PfxPassword “certsecret” $portalHostnameConf = New-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameConfiguration -Hostname “portal.contoso.com” -CertificateThumbprint 33CC47C6FCA848DC9B14A6F071C1EF7C $proxyHostnameConf = New-AzureRmApiManagementHostnameConfiguration -Hostname “proxy.contoso.com” -CertificateThumbprint 5DD7CCF6A1E74E0987DD2873406B7264 Set-AzureApiHostnames -Name ContosoApi -ResourceGroupName Contoso –PortalHostnameConfiguration $portalHostnameConf –ProxyHostnameConfiguration $proxyHostnameConf

dev:remarks.maml:para: Script to configure custom hostname for proxy and portal. First import corresponding certificates and then apply custom hostnames.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates deployment of an API Management Service.
Update-AzureRmApiManagementDeployment cmdlet updates current deployment (scales, adds/removes additional deployment regions).
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Location of master API Management deployment region.
The tier of master Azure API Management deployment region. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium.
Sku capacity of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Virtual Network Configuration of master Azure API Management deployment region.

Virtual Network Type of the ApiManagement Deployment. Valid Values are - "None" (Default Value. ApiManagement is not part of any Virtual Network") - "External" (ApiManagement Deployment has an External Facing VIP) - "Internal" (ApiManagement Deployment has an Intranet Facing VIP)
Additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Sends updated PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
PsApiManagement instance to get deployment configuration from. Use the parameter the instance already has all the required changes (scale up/down, add/remove/update regions).
Sends updated PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
Name of resource group under which API Management exists.
Name of API Management.
Location of master API Management deployment region.
The tier of master Azure API Management deployment region. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium.
Sku capacity of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Virtual Network Configuration of master Azure API Management deployment region.
Additional deployment regions of Azure API Management.
Sends updated PsApiManagement to pipeline if operation succeeds.
PsApiManagement instance to get deployment configuration from. Use the parameter the instance already has all the required changes (scale up/down, add/remove/update regions).

Virtual Network Type of the ApiManagement Deployment. Valid Values are - "None" (Default Value. ApiManagement is not part of any Virtual Network") - "External" (ApiManagement Deployment has an External Facing VIP) - "Internal" (ApiManagement Deployment has an Intranet Facing VIP)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Command to update deployment of an ApiManagement to 3 unit ‘Standard’.
Script to get an ApiManagement, scale to 5 ‘Premium’ units and add additional 3 unit ‘Premium’ region.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates existing deployment region in PsApiManagement instance.

Update-AzureRmApiManagementRegion cmdlet updates (scales up/down or changes VPN configuration) existing instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagementRegion in collection of AdditionalRegions of provided instance of type Microsoft.Azure.Commands.ApiManagement.Models.PsApiManagement. This cmdlet does not deploy anything by itself but updates instance of PsApiManagement in-memory. Related cmdltes are: Add-AzureRmApiManagementRegion and Remove-AzureRmApiManagementRegion. To actually update a deployment of an API Management pass the modified PsApiManagementInstance to Update-AzureRmApiManagement cmdlet.
PsApiManagement instance to update existing deployment region in.
Location of the deployment region to update.
New tier value for the deployment region. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium.
New Sku capacity value for the deployment region.
Virtual network configuration for the deployemnt region. Default value is $null. Passing $null will remove virtual network configuration for the region.
PsApiManagement instance to update existing deployment region in.
Location of the deployment region to update.
New tier value for the deployment region. Valid values are Developer, Standard and Premium.
New Sku capacity value for the deployment region.
Virtual network configuration for the deployemnt region. Default value is $null. Passing $null will remove virtual network configuration for the region.
Creates an instance of PsApiManagementRegion.
Helper command to create an instance of PsApiManagementRegion. This command is to be used with New-AzureRmApiManagement command.
Location of the additional deployment region.
Sku capacity of the Azure API Management service additional region. Default value is 1.
Virtual Network Configuration of Azure API Management deployment region. Default value is $null.
Location of the additional deployment region.
Sku capacity of the Azure API Management service additional region. Default value is 1.
Virtual Network Configuration of Azure API Management deployment region. Default value is $null.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$apimRegion = New-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "Central US"
$additionalRegions = @($apimRegion)
New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup -Location "West US" -Name ContosoApi -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -AdditionalRegions $additionalRegions -Sku "Premium"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$apimRegionVirtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork –Location "Central US" –SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc7-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/centralusvirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet"
$apimRegion = New-AzureRmApiManagementRegion -Location "Central US" -VirtualNetwork $apimRegionVirtualNetwork
$additionalRegions = @($apimRegion)
$virtualNetwork = New-AzureRmApiManagementVirtualNetwork –Location "West US" –SubnetResourceId "/subscriptions/a8ff56dc-3bc2-4174-a1e8-3726ab15d0e2/resourceGroups/ContosoGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/westUsVirtualNetwork/subnets/backendSubnet"
New-AzureRmApiManagement -ResourceGroupName ContosoGroup -Location "West US" -Name ContosoApi -Organization Contoso -AdminEmail admin@contoso.com -AdditionalRegions $additionalRegions -VirtualNetwork $virtualNetwork -VpnType "External" -Sku "Premium"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an ApiManagement service of External VpnType in West US Region, with an Additional Region in Central US.
